Step2: Preheat a clean grill. Coat squid with oil and grill over high heat for 1 minute per side. Set aside for 5 minutes. Cut into bite-size pieces.
Step3: Combine squid with ginger, onion, tomato, cucumber, green finger chili and red chili. Season with sugar, calamansi and salt. Toss well, transfer into a plate and serve.

name: Beef Caldereta sa Gata
instructions: Step1: Simmer beef in water with bay leaves and peppercorn in a pot until tender. Add water as needed.
Step2: Fry potato and carrot in oil until golden brown, strain and set aside.
Step3: Sauté garlic, onion and chili in the same pan for 2 minutes. Add liver spread and cook for another 2 minutes.

Step4: Pour tomato sauce and 2 cups of beef broth in the pot. Add pickle relish, beef, potato, carrot, coconut milk and sugar. Simmer for another 10 minutes. Season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Fish Fillet and Tofu
instructions: Step1: Season fish with MAGGI® Magic Sarap® coat with flour and fry in oil. Remove and set aside. Fry tofu in the same oil until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Remove oil from the pan leaving 2 tbsp. Sauté garlic, ginger and onion. Pour water and  add MAGGI® Oyster Sauce and pepper. Stir in cornstarch and water mixture to thicken the sauce.
Step3: Toss in fish and tofu. Transfer into a serving plate and serve immediately.

name: Samgyupsal Rice with Shrimp and Vegetables
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Heat cooking oil. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook shrimp until shrimp turns pink in color.
Step2: Stir-in left-over samgyupsal and the thinly sliced cucumber. Add rice and stir well until fully incorporated.
Step3: Season with soy souce Sauce and MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Add petchay Baguio and remove from heat.

name: Pan Roasted Chicken
instructions: Step1: Season chicken with 2½ sachets of MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and ¾ tsp of pepper.
Step2: Combine butter, garlic, lemon zest and parsley in a bowl. Spread butter mixture between the skin and meat of the chicken.
Step3: Sear chicken on both sides in olive oil until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
Step4: Sauté back bone, onion, carrot and celery in the same pan. Place chicken skin side up, cover and cook over low heat for 15mins. Remove chicken and set aside to rest.

Step5: Stir in flour in the pan. Pour water, add bay leaf and thyme and simmer until thick. Strain into a sauce pan and season with remaining ½ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®, ¼ tsp of pepper and lemon juice. Pour into a serving bowl and serve with chicken.

name: Adobo Flakes
instructions: Step1: Season pork with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Sauté pork and garlic in 1 tbsp of oil until golden brown.
Step2: Pour vinegar, Soy sauce and water. Add bay leaf and pepper simmer until tender. Set aside overnight in the refrigerator.
Step3: Shred pork and set aside. Sauté in oil until crispy. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with rice, fried egg and spiced vinegar.

name: Sinampalukang Adobo
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
1 Sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sinigang Sampalok With Gabi Mix
instructions: Step1: Combine pork, garlic, peppercorn, vinegar, soy souce and water in a pot. Cover, bring to a boil and simmer with while covered for 45 minutes over low heat. Avoid opening lid.
Step2: Drain pork into a colander with a bowl and set aside to rest for 5 minutes. Separate pork from garlic and peppercorn.

Step3: Heat oil in a separate pan, add pork and sauté for 3 minutes over medium heat. Add garlic and peppercorn and continue to sauté for another 2 minutes. Pour cooking liquid to the pan with pork and simmer for another 10 minutes while occasionally stirring . Remove and set aside.

Step4: Combine water, onion, tomato and gabi in a pot. Bring to a boil and simmer while covered for 15 minutes. Mash the gabi to thicken the soup.Add finger chili, radish, okra and sitaw with 2-minute intervals. Pour MAGGI® MAGIC SINIGANG®. Stir in reserved adobo and kangkong. Transfer into a serving bowl and serve immediately.

name: Patatim
ingredients: 2 tbsp of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Heat oil in a large pan and sear pork on all sides. Remove and set aside.

Step2: Sauté ginger, onion, mushroom, star anise and peppercorn in the same pan. Pour wine, MAGGI Oyster Sauce and MAGGI Soy. Add pork and barely cover with water. Simmer for 2 ½ hour or until tender.
Step3: Remove pork and set aside.  Strain cooking liquid into a pot. Simmer and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Stir in cornstarch and water mixture to thicken the sauce.
Step4: Transfer pork in a serving plate. Pour sauce on top and serve with mushroom and bokchoy.

name: Dinuguan
instructions: Step1: Simmer pork and intestine in water. Drain and rinse well. Cut into serving pieces.
Step2: Sauté garlic, ginger, onion and chili in oil. Add bay leaf, vinegar, pork cheeks and intestines. Pour water to barely cover the pork. Cover and simmer until tender.
Step3: Stir in pork blood and cook until slightly thick. Season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, pepper and sugar. Transfer into a serving plate.

name: Ginisang Corned Beef
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic in oil until golden brown.
Step2: Add potato and cook until light golden brown. Add corned beef .
Step3: Add onion and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Paksiw na Baboy
instructions: Step1: Sauté saging na saba in oil until golden brown. Remove and set aside
Step2: Combine pork, vinegar, water, garlic, brown sugar, banana blossoms, bay leaf, MAGGI® Oyster Sauce in a pot. Simmer until tender.
Step3: Stir in saging na saba and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Transfer into as serving plate and serve.

name: Nilagang Baka
instructions: Step1: Simmer beef in water until slightly tender. Skim off fat as needed.
Step2: Add onion, bay leaves, peppercorn. Simmer until beef is very tender.
Step3: Add corn and simmer for 10 minutes. Add potato, cabbage and spring onion. Season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer into a serving bowl and serve.

name: Open-Faced Scrambled Egg Sandwich
instructions: Step1: Lightly spread 2 tbsp of butter on pan de sal. Toast until light golden brown.
Step2: Beat eggs with ½ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and cheese. Set aside.
Step3: Sauté garlic, onion and tomato in butter for 2mins. Season with remaining ½ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Pour beaten eggs and cook until barely set.
Step4: Place on top of toasted pan de sal. Top with red onion and spring onion. Serve immediately.

name: Shakshuka-Style Eggs
instructions: Step1: Sauté onion, bell pepper, garlic, chili and curry in olive oil.
Step2: Add tomato and cook for 10 minutes. Pour water and season with ¾ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®, pepper and sugar.
Step3: Make 4 wells in the sauce and carefully crack the egg nestled in the sauce. Season eggs with remaining ¼ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Cover and cook over low heat for 2 minutes.
Step4: Top with chopped cilantro and serve in the same pan.

name: Chicken Pork Adobo with Pineapple
instructions: Step1: Combine chicken, pork, garlic, bay leaf, MAGGI® Oyster Sauce, MAGGI Soy, pineapple juice and water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside. Continue to simmer for 30 minutes. Strain pork and set aside.
Step2: Sauté chicken and pork in oil until golden brown. Pour Heat oil in a separate pan, strain pork and sauté until golden brown.
Step3: Pour cooking liquid and simmer for 5 minutes. Transfer into a serving plate and serve.

name: Honey Glazed Chicken
ingredients: 0.5 Kg of Chicken Thigh And Leg
instructions: Step1: Season chicken with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and pepper. Sauté in oil. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Add garlic, cinnamon powder, star anise, vinegar, soy sauce, honey and pineapple juice. Bring to simmer.
Step3: Add chicken and simmer for 20 minutes. Let the sauce reduce to glaze consistency. Coat the chicken well with the glaze, transfer into a serving plate and serve.

name: Creamy Chicken Menudo
ingredients: 1 package of NESTLÉ All Purpose Cream 125ml
instructions: Step1: Sauté potato and carrot in oil until golden brown. Strain and set aside.
Step2: Sauté garlic and onion in the same pan. Add chicken and bell peppers. Sauté for 5 minutes.
Step3: Add tomato sauce, water and bay leaf. Stir and simmer for 10 minutes.
Step4: Add sautéed potato, carrot and cheese. Season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®, pepper and sugar.
Step5: Stir in Nestlé® All Purpose Cream. Simmer for another 2 minutes. Transfer into a serving plate and serve.

name: Omurice
ingredients: 100 g of Chicken Thigh And Leg
0.5 cup of Vegetables, mixed (corn, lima beans, peas, green beans, carrots) canned, no salt added
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion and chicken in 1 tbsp of oil.
Step2: Add corn, carrot and green peas. Season with ¾ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and MAGGI Oyster Sauce. Mix in rice and cook for 2 minutes. Transfer on a serving plate.

Step3: Beat eggs with remaining ¼ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Heat a nonstick pan and add remaining 1 tbsp of oil. Pour beaten eggs and stir with a spatula for 30secs. Move egg to one side of the pan and fold to form a football shaped omelet.
Step4: Place omelet on top of the rice and slice open to expose runny center of the egg. Drizzle catsup, top with spring onion and serve warm.

name: All-in-Onederful Ginisang Ampalaya at Corned Beef
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion, tomato and corned beef in oil.
Step2: Add ampalaya and sauté for 5 minutes. Stir in beaten egg and cook until barely set.
Step3: Season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and pour water. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Magical Ginisang Upo at Sardinas
ingredients: 2 cans of Sardines in Tomato Sauce
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion, tomato and sardines in oil.
Step2: Add upo and cook for 2 minutes.
Step3: Pour water, bring to simmer and season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Tortang Talong with Luncheon Meat
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion, tomato, potato and luncheon meat in oil for 15 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Step2: Beat eggs and add to filling mixture. Season with remaining sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®.
Step3: Season roasted eggplant with remaining ½ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Place egg mixture on top of the eggplant.
Step4: Fry for 2 minutes per side. Drain excess oil. Repeat with the rest of the Torta. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with preferred dipping sauce.

name: All-in-Onederful Lumpiang Corned Beef
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion and potato in oil for 5mins. Add carrot and corned beef. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Step2: Stir in cabbage and season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer on a wide plate to cool down completely.
Step3: Assemble 2 tbsp of the corned beef mixture with the lumpia wrapper.
Step4: Fry in preheated oil until golden brown. Transfer on a cooling rack to drain excess oil.
Step5: Cut in half and serve with spiced vinegar.

name: Corned Beef Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 cup of frozen green peas, carrot and corn
instructions: Step1: Sauté corned beef in its own juices until crispy. Remove corned beef and set aside.
Step2: Sauté garlic in oil. Strain and set aside for topping.
Step3: Sauté onion in the same oil. Strain and set aside for topping.
Step4: Add rice and vegetables in the same pan. Fluff for 2 mins. Make a well in the center of the pan and pour beaten egg. Stir and cook until just set.
Step5: Season fried rice with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer on a serving plate, top with crispy corned beef, sautéed onion, toasted garlic and spring onion. Serve immediately.

name: Sardines Fried Rice
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion, tomato and sardines in oil. Pour sauce and cook for 2 minutes.
Step2: Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Push on one side, pour beaten eggs and cook until barely set. Mix well with the rice.
Step3: Season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and stir in spring onion. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Homemade BLT
instructions: Step1: Season pork belly with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®, pepper and sugar. Set aside for 10mins.
Step2: Sauté pork in oil until golden brown and crispy. Remove and set aside.
Step3: Lightly spread butter on white bread and toast until light golden brown. Spread mayonnaise and assemble tomato, lettuce and pork belly. Serve immediately.

name: Tuna Sandwich
ingredients: 2 cans of Fish, tuna, light, canned in oil, drained solids
1 package of NESTLÉ® All Purpose Cream
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic in oil until light golden brown. Add tuna and cook for 2mins.
Step2: Turn off heat. Stir in NESTLÉ All Purpose Cream, mayonnaise, MAGGI® Magic Sarap®, onion and spring onion.  Set aside.
Step3: Lightly spread butter on wheat bread. Toast until light golden brown. Assemble filling of lettuce, tomato and tuna spread. Serve immediately.

name: Lumpiang Sardinas with Sweet Spicy Sauce
ingredients: 2 cans of Spicy Sardines in Tomato Sauce
instructions: Step1: Strain sardines and reserve tomato sauce. Remove backbone and flake sardines. Set aside.
Step2: Sauté sardines, onion, carrot and singkamas in oil. Season with ¾ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer on a wide plate to cool.
Step3: Wrap 2 tbsp of the sardine mixture with lumpia wrapper. Fry in oil until golden brown. Transfer on a cooling rack to drain excess oil.
Step4: To make the sauce, combine reserved sauce, water, brown sugar and remaining ¼ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Simmer for 1min. Pour into a serving container and top with spring onion.
Step5: Cut lumpia in half, transfer on a serving plate and serve with dipping sauce.

name: Chicken Fried Rice
instructions: Step1: Heat 1tbsp of oil in a wok and pour eggs. Stir and cook until barely set. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Sauté garlic, onion, chicken and vegetables in oil. Add with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®, MAGGI® Oyster Sauce and pepper.
Step3: Add rice and cook for 5 minutes. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Crispy Corned Beef Fried Rice
instructions: Step1: Sauté corned beef in its own oil until crispy. Remove corned beef and set aside.
Step2: Sauté garlic in oil. Strain and set aside for topping.
Step3: Sauté onion in the same oil. Strain and set aside for topping.
Step4: Add rice in the same pan. Fluff and cook for 1min. Make a well in the center of the pan and pour beaten egg. Stir and cook until just set.

Step5: Season fried rice with MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and MAGGI® Savor Classic. Transfer on a serving plate, top with crispy corned beef, sautéed onion, toasted garlic and spring onion. Serve immediately.

name: Fried Tanigue
instructions: Step1: Season tanigue with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Coat lightly with flour.
Step2: Preheat oil in large pan and pan fry tanigue for until golden brown. Transfer on a cooling rack to drain excess oil. Transfer on a plate and serve.

name: All-in-One Tortang Corned Beef
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion, potato and corned beef in oil in a non stick pan.
Step2: Beat eggs and season with 8g MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Pour and stir until barely set and continue to cook over low heat.
Step3: Place a plate to cover, flip and slide back the egg to the pan to cook the other side. Remove from the pan and set aside. Cut into serving pieces, transfer on a serving plate and serve warm.

name: Tortang Talong at Corned Beef
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion, corned beef in oil. Set aside.
Step2: Beat 2pcs egg , add half of meat mixture, season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and place on top of the eggplant. Fry for 2mins per side. Remove from the pan and repeat with the second eggplant.
Step3: Drain excess oil. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with preferred dipping sauce.

name: Tuna Pizza Pan de Sal
instructions: Step1: Mash tuna in tomato sauce. Season with ½ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®.
Step2: Toast pan de sal until light golden brown.
Step3: Spread tuna mixture, add tomato slices and season with remaining ½ sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Grate cheese on top and bake until golden brown.
Step4: Transfer on a serving plate and top with spring onion.

name: Pancit Bihon and Canton Guisado
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Sauté pork, garlic and onion in oil. Pour water and season with MAGGI®  Oyster Sauce, soy souce, MAGGI®  MAGIC SARAP® and pepper.
Step2: Stir in bihon, cover and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in pansit canton, carrot,cabbage and snow peas. Cover and cook another 2 minutes.
Step3: Add sesame oil. Gently toss and transfer into a serving plate. Serve with calamansi.

name: Pork Afritada
instructions: Step1: Sauté potato and carrot in 1 tbsp oil until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Season pork shoulder with 1 sachet of MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Sauté pork in the same pan. Remove and set aside.
Step3: Sauté garlic, onion and bell peppers. Pour tomato sauce and water. Add pork, bay leaf, pepper and sugar. Simmer for 1 hour.
Step4: Add potato and carrot. Season with remaining sachet of MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and simmer for another 10 minutes. Transfer into a serving plate and serve.

name: Ginisang Sayote with Hibe
instructions: Step1: Sauté the garlic, onion, tomato and hibe in oil.
Step2: Add sayote and cook for 2 minutes.
Step3: Pour in water, simmer and season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Garlic Beef
ingredients: 1 tbl of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season beef with MAGGI®  MAGIC SARAP® and pepper. Set aside
Step2: Sauté garlic in butter until light golden brown. Move on the side and add beef. Sauté over high heat for 1 minute.
Step3: Stir in MAGGI®  Soy and sugar. Transfer on a serving plate and top with spring onion.

name: Pork Binagoongan
instructions: Step1: Simmer pork in water until tender. Strain and set aside. Reserve 1 cup of the pork stock.
Step2: Slice pork and fry in oil until golden brown. Set aside. Fry eggplant in the same oil until golden brown. Set aside.

Step3: Remove oil from the pan leaving 2 tbsp. Sauté garlic, onion, tomato, chili and bagoong. Pour vinegar. Stir in reserved pork stock and season with MAGGI® 
MAGIC SARAP® and sugar.
Step4: Cut pork into pieces and add to the sauce. Pour in coconut cream and simmer for 2 minutes.  Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Fried Eggs
instructions: Step1: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a non-stick pan. Crack a fresh egg in a small bowl and carefully place in the pan.
Step2: Season with a pinch of MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and fry according to preferred doneness of the yolk. Repeat process.
Step3: Slide out of the pan on a plate and serve.

name: Luncheon Meat Fried Rice
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion and luncheon meat in oil.
Step2: Push ingredients on the side and pour beaten egg. Stir and cook until barely set.
Step3: Add rice and season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Pour 2tbsp of water on the side and gently fluff until steaming hot. Stir in spring onion. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Pork Sinigang with Gabi
ingredients: 1 sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sinigang Sampalok With Gabi Mix
instructions: Step1: Simmer pork with water with onion and tomatoes for 45 minutes.
Step2: Add siling panigang, radish, okra and sitaw with 2-min intervals.
Step3: Pour MAGGI® Magic Sinigang with Gabi. Stir in kangkong. Transfer into a serving bowl and serve immediately.

name: Teriyaki-Style Beef Tapa
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate beef in MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, MAGGI Soy,  sake, chili paste, honey, ginger, garlic and sesame oil.
Step2: Quickly sauté beef in oil over high heat.
Step3: Immediately transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Bistek
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Sauté onion in oil until light golden brown. Set aside.
Step2: Season beef with MAGGI®  MAGIC SARAP® and pepper. Sauté beef in oil until golden brown and set aside.
Step3: Sauté garlic in oil in the same pan. Add beef, soy souce and sugar. Barely cover with water and simmer until tender.
Step4: Add calamansi juice and add sautéed onion. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Tinurbong Liempo
ingredients: 1 tbl of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Place pork belly in a pot just big enough to hold the meat and water. Add garlic and peppercorn and simmer until very tender. Drain and set aside to cool. Preheat turbo broiler at 375°F.
Step2: Season pork with MAGGI®  MAGIC SARAP® and MAGGI®  Soy. Place on a rack in the turbo broiler. Broil until skin is crisp and golden brown.
Step3: Remove from the turbo broiler and set aside. Cut into serving pieces and serve with preferred dipping sauce.

name: Ginisang Sari-saring Gulay
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion and tomato in oil.
Step2: Pour water and simmer. Add kalabasa, ampalaya and eggplant and simmer for 2mins. Add okra and sitaw and simmer for another 2mins.
Step3: Season with MAGGI® Magic Sarap®. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Fish Kare-Kare
instructions: Step1: Heat atchuete oil. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant. Add talong then after 30 seconds add sitaw.
Step2: Pour in water and bring to a boil. Thicken with peanut butter and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, patis and sugar.
Step3: Add pechay then remove from heat. Top fried fish with kare-kare sauce before serving.

name: Chinese-Style Grilled Spareribs
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season pork with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Combine soy souce, pepper, hoisin, chili garlic paste and sesame oil. Use half to marinate pork overnight in the refrigerator. Reserve half for grilling.
Step2: Remove pork from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Grill pork for 5 minutes per side over medium heat.
Step3: Brush with the reserved glaze and set aside. Cut into serving pieces, transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Pocherong Manok
instructions: Step1: Season chicken with 1 sachet of MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Sauté in oil and set aside.
Step2: Sauté kamote and saba in oil until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
Step3: Sauté garlic, onion, chorizo in oil. Pour tomato sauce and water. Add chicken, bay leaf and chick peas and simmer for 20 minutes.
Step4: Add kamote, saging na saba and cabbage. Season with remaining sachet of MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and sugar. Transfer into a serving bowl and serve.

name: Crispy Beef Short Ribs
ingredients: 1 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Simmer beef in a small pot with water until slightly tender.  Add MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, MAGGI Soy , onion, garlic, black peppercorn, bay leaves, star anise and brown sugar.  Simmer until very tender. Set aside to cool completely. Cooking liquid may be served as broth.
Step2: Strain beef.  Coat each rib with beaten egg and cornstarch. Deep fry in preheated oil until golden brown. Drain excess oil.
Step3: Transfer on a serving plate and top with scallions and sesame seeds. Serve with spiced vinegar.

name: Sampyupsal with Marinated Grilled Vegetable
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate eggplant, okra, leeks, carrots and sweet potato in the prepared marinade for at least 30 minutes. Grill until cooked and pork tender. Set aside.
Step2: Arrange on a salad plate. Top with chopped peanuts and sliced left-over samgyupsal.
Step3: Serve as a salad appetizer or as main dish.

name: Beef Tapa with Coconut Cream
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate beef with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, pepper, sugar, garlic and MAGGI® Soy.
Step2: Quickly sauté beef in oil over high heat. Add coconut cream and simmer.
Step3: Immediately transfer on a serving plate, top with toasted garlic and spring onion and serve.

name: Chicken Arroz Caldo
instructions: Step1: Sauté chicken in oil. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Sauté garlic, ginger and onion in the same pot. Add rice, pour water and simmer while covered for 30 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Step3: Add chicken and kasubha and cook for another 15 minutes. Season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and pepper.  Serve with preferred garnishes.

name: Crispy Pork Ribs
ingredients: 1 tbl of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
2 Pieces of Red And Green Chili
instructions: Step1: Marinate pork with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, meat tenderizer, five spice powder, ginger juice, soy sauce and sesame oil overnight in the refrigerator.
Step2: Coat pork with beaten egg and cornstarch. Fry pork in preheated oil until golden brown. Set aside to drain excess oil.
Step3: Remove oil leaving 1 tbsp in the pan. Sauté garlic and chilies. Add pork and coat well. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with spiced vinegar.

name: Fish Teriyaki
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, ginger and onion in oil. Add mirin, sugar, water, soy sauce and sesame oil. Simmer until slightly thick. Set aside.
Step2: Season fish with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and coat with oil. Grill for 2 minutes per side while brushing with the teriyaki sauce.
Step3: Transfer on a plate, pour sauce on top and garnish with spring onion and sesame seeds.

name: Beef Sukiyaki
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Simmer water, MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, MAGGI Soy, mirin and sugar in a kettle.
Step2: Arrange noodles, beef, carrot, scallions, tofu, mushroom and cabbage in a wide serving pot.
Step3: Crack the egg in the center and pour boiling broth. Serve immediately.

name: Beef Mechado
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate beef in MAGGI® Soy and calamansi juice.
Step2: Sauté garlic and onion in oil. Add beef with the marinade. Pour water and simmer until beef is tender. Add water as needed.
Step3: Add tomato sauce, potato, carrot and bell pepper and continue to simmer until sauce is thick. Season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Fish Tocho
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season bangus with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, coat with flour and fry until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Remove oil leaving 2 tbsp in the pan. Sauté  ginger, onion, tomato and yellow beans. Pour water and soy souce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Step3: Transfer fried bangus on a serving plate, pour sauce on top and serve.

name: Chicken Inasal
instructions: Step1: Marinate the chicken with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, MAGGI Soy, vinegar, garlic, lemongrass, ginger and sugar in the refrigerator overnight.
Step2: Gently heat annatto seeds and oil in a pan. Strain and set aside.
Step3: Remove chicken from the refrigerator 1 hour before grilling. Skewer chicken in thick bamboo sticks.
Step4: Grill chicken over charcoal using low heat. Brush chicken with annatto oil. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with sinamak.

name: Litsong Manok
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate chicken with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, pepper, soy souce, sugar, garlic and lemongrass overnight in the refrigerator.
Step2: Remove chicken from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Truss with butcher’s twine and transfer into a roasting pan.
Step3: Roast in a 350°F preheated oven for 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside to rest. Cut into serving pieces and baste with the drippings. Serve immediately.

name: Humba
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Combine pork, soy souce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaf, peppercorn, sugar and water in a pot.  Simmer for 30 minutes.
Step2: Add tausi, peanuts, tajure and MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Continue to simmer until pork is tender. Skim off fat.
Step3: Transfer on a serving plate and pour sauce on top. Optional to serve with quail eggs.

name: Grilled Tuna Belly
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate tuna with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, pepper, soy souce, calamansi juice and garlic for 1 hour.
Step2: Preheat a clean grill. Coat tuna with oil and grill for 5 – 8 minutes per side. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with spiced vinegar.

name: Kimchi Fried Rice (Bokkeumbap)
instructions: Step1: Put bacon and cook until fat is extracted. Sauté the garlic and onion in bacon fat until translucent.
Step2: Stir-in kimchi then rice. Season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and mix thoroughly until fully incorporated.
Step3: Add mushrooms and chili paste (optional) to taste. Cook while stirring for another minute.
Step4: Top with fried egg if desired before serving.

name: Korean Barbecue
ingredients: 0.25 tbl of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate beef with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAPc, pepper, MAGGI® Soy, brown sugar, chili garlic paste, sesame oil, sesame seeds and spring onion.
Step2: Coat beef with the oil and grill for 1 minute per side. Set aside. Cut into bite-size pieces
Step3: Place lettuce on the platter, top with grilled beef and top with spring onion and sesame seeds.

name: Cheesy Chicken Rice Casserole
ingredients: 0.5 Kg of Chicken Thigh And Leg
instructions: Step1: Season chicken with 1 sachet of MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®and coat with flour. Sauté in olive oil until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Add shallots, garlic, carrot, celery and potato in the same pan and sauté for 10 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Step3: Pour water and add sautéed chicken, bay leaf, thyme, rosemary and mushroom. Season with remaining sachet ofMAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and simmer.
Step4: Place in a preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven, garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Salted Egg Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 tbl of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Sauté shrimp, chicken, dulong and salted eggs in oil. Push ingredients on the side and pour beaten eggs. Stir and cook until just set.
Step2: Add rice and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, sugar, pepper and MAGGI Soy. Pour 2 tbsp of water on the side and gently fluff until steaming hot.
Step3: Stir in spring onion and lettuce. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Chicken Barbeque
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season chicken with MAGGI®  MAGIC SARAP® and set aside.

Step2: Mix soy souce, garlic, red chili, sugar, catsup, peanut butter and pepper.  Divide into 2 portions. Marinate chicken  with 1 portion of the barbeque sauce and marinate overnight in the refrigerator. Reserve second portion for basting.

Step3: Remove chicken from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Grill chicken over charcoal using low heat. Brush with the reserved barbeque sauce. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with spiced vinegar and atchara.

name: Chicken Pineapple Rice
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Cook beaten egg in 1 tbsp of oil until barely set. Remove and set aside.
Step2: Sauté chicken in oil.  Push on the side and add garlic, onion and pineapple tidbits and soy souce.

Step3: Add rice and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Pour 2 tbsp of water on the side and gently fluff until steaming hot. Add scrambled egg, sesame oil and spring onion. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Adobong Puti
instructions: Step1: Combine chicken, pork, garlic, vinegar, water and sugar in a pot. Bring to a simmer.
Step2: Sauté liver, chicken and pork in oil until golden brown. Pour cooking liquid, season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and simmer until sauce is thick. Transfer into a serving plate and serve.

name: Inihaw na Liempo
instructions: Step1: Marinate pork belly with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, soy sauce, catsup, brown sugar, chili, garlic and pepper overnight in the refrigerator.
Step2: Remove pork from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Coat pork with oil.
Step3: Grill pork until cooked and golden brown. Transfer on a serving plate and serve  with spiced vinegar.

name: Steamed Maya-Maya
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season snapper with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Stuff with lemongrass, ginger, onion and garlic.
Step2: Place in a plate and cook in a steamer for 10 – 15 minutes. Remove from the steamer and set aside to rest. Reserve liquid and aromatic vegetables.

Step3: Combine water, soy souce, reserved aromatic vegetables and liquid from fish in a pot. Simmer until slightly thick. Strain into another pan and add sesame oil.  Pour sauce on the fish and garnish with wansuy and scallions. Serve immediately.

name: Beef Tapa
instructions: Step1: Marinate beef with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, pepper, sugar, garlic and soy sauce for 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.
Step2: Remove from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking and remove garlic.
Step3: Sauté beef in oil over high heat. Transfer on a serving plate, top with toasted garlic and serve.

name: Creamy Lengua Estofado
ingredients: 2 tbsp of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
0.5 cup of Nestlé® All Purpose Cream
instructions: Step1: Simmer beef tongue in water for 1 hour. Add garlic, onion, bay leaf and peppercorn. Simmer until tender. Strain and set aside to cool. Strain stock and reserve for sauce.
Step2: Sauté garlic and mushroom in butter. Add flour. Stir in 4 cups of reserved stock and simmer. Simmer until thick.

Step3: Remove skin of the tongue and slice. Add to the sauce and season with MAGGI MAGIC SARAP® and MAGGI Soy. Turn off heat and stir in Nestlé All Purpose Cream and parsley. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.?

name: Sinuglaw
ingredients: 1 Sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sinigang Sampalok With Gabi Mix
2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Combine pork belly, ½ pack of MAGGI® MAGIC SINIGANG® Original Sampaloc Mix and soy souce. Set aside for 2 hours. Coat well with oil and grill for 4 – 5 minutes per side. Set aside to rest.

Step2: Combine tuna and remaining ½ pack of MAGGI®  MAGIC SINIGANG®  Original Sampaloc Mix. Add onion, ginger, finger chili, red chili and cucumber. Pour coconut milk and season with salt. Gently mix together. Refrigerate for 10 minutes.
Step3: Cut grilled pork belly into bite-size pieces. Transfer Kilawing Tuna in a serving plate, top with grilled pork belly and serve.

name: Lemongrass Fried Chicken
ingredients: 1 Piece of Red And Green Chili
instructions: Step1: Combine water, lime juice, lime zest, lemongrass, ginger, turmeric, shallots, garlic, chili, MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, soy sauce, pepper and sugar in a blender. Purée until smooth.
Step2: Pour marinade to the chicken and marinate overnight in the refrigerator.
Step3: Coat chicken with rice flour. Fry in preheated oil until golden brown. Set aside to drain excess oil. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with sweet chili sauce.

name: Egg Drop Soup Recipe
instructions: Step1: Simmer water and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®.
Step2: Pour cornstarch and water mixture while stirring to thicken the soup.
Step3: Pour beaten egg while stirring. Stir in spring onion. Transfer into a serving bowl an serve immediately.

name: Creamy Beef and Mushroom
ingredients: 1 tbl of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
1 Package of Nestlé® All Purpose Cream
instructions: Step1: Season beef with ½ sachet of MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, MAGGI Soy, Worcestershire sauce and pepper.
Step2: Sauté beef in oil in several batches. Remove and set aside.
Step3: Sauté garlic, onion and mushroom in butter in the same pan. Add flour. . Stir in water and simmer. Add beef and season with remaining ½ sachet of MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®.
Step4: Pour Nestlé All Purpose Cream, turn off heat and stir in parsley. Transfer on a serving plate and serve immediately.

name: Grilled Boneless Bangus
instructions: Step1: Season bangus with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and pepper. Add soy sauce and calamansi juice. Set aside.
Step2: Preheat a clean grill. Coat bangus with vegetable oil. Grill for 3 – 4 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
Step3: Cut into serving pieces, transfer on a serving plate and serve with Ensalada of onion tomato and salted egg.

name: Osso Buco Style Beef Caldereta
ingredients: 0.25 cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season beef with 1 sachet of MAGGI MAGIC SARAP®. Sauté in olive oil, until golden brown. Remove and set aside.?

Step2: Sauté garlic, onion and bell pepper in olive oil.  Add tomato paste, beef, bay leaves, MAGGI Soy and tomato sauce. Pour enough water to barely cover the beef. Simmer until meat is tender.  Skim off fat as needed.?
Step3: Season with remaining 1 sachet MAGGI MAGIC SARAP®. Add carrots, garbanzos and olives and simmer until sauce is reduced. Stir in keso de bola. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.?

name: Breaded Pork Chop
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season pork chops with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, soy souce and pepper. Coat with flour, dip in beaten egg and coat with bread crumbs. Set aside.
Step2: Pan fry pork in preheated oil until golden brown. Set aside to drain excess oil. Transfer on a serving plate and serve with preferred dipping sauce.

name: Filipino-Style Roast Pork
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Season pork with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, pepper, soy souce, calamansi juice and garlic. Marinate overnight in the refrigerator .
Step2: Tie into a roll using a butcher’s twine. Place in a roasting pan with rack. Pour 1-inch of water into the pan. Roast for 2 hours. Remove from the oven and set aside for 15 minutes.
Step3: Strain drippings into a sauce pan, skim off fat and simmer until slightly thick.
Step4: Remove butcher’s twine and slice into serving portions. Transfer on a serving plate, pour sauce on top and serve.

name: White Chicken Sinigang with Gabi
ingredients: 1 Sachet of MAGGI® Magic Sinigang Original Sampalok Mix
2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Heat oil in a pot and sauté garlic, ginger, onion, tomatoes and finger chili for 2 minutes. Add chicken and continue to cook for 2 minutes. Pour rice washing, bring to a boil, skim the scum and simmer for 5 minutes.
Step2: Pour MAGGI® MAGIC SINIGANG® Original with Gabi, fish sauce and brown sugar. Set aside for another 15 minutes.
Step3: Remove chicken and set aside. Strain the broth into a pot. Purée strained garlic, ginger, onion, tomatoes and finger chili until smooth. Set aside as dipping sauce.
Step4: Cook rice with 3 cups of the sinigang broth. Reserve remaining broth to serve as soup.

Step5: To assemble, debone chicken and cut into serving pieces. Serve on top of rice with cucumber, tomato, spring onion and cilantro. Serve with dipping sauce and soy souce. Garnish broth with spring onion.

name: Chicken Teriyaki
ingredients: 0.25 Cup of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, ginger and onion in oil. Add mirin, sugar, water, soy souce, pepper and sesame oil. Simmer until slightly thick. Divide into 2 portions and set aside.
Step2: Season chicken with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and coat one portion of the Teriyaki sauce. Grill for 3 – 4 minutes per side while brushing with the teriyaki sauce.
Step3: Cut into serving pieces and transfer on a plate. Garnish with spring onion and sesame seeds.

name: Inihaw na Pusit
ingredients: 2 tbls of Maggi® Soy Cooking And Seasoning Sauce
instructions: Step1: Marinate squid in MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®, soy souce, calamansi juice, garlic and ginger.
Step2: Stuff squid with onion and tomato. Score squid lightly for even grilling. Coat lightly with oil.
Step3: Grill over hot charcoal for 2 minutes per side. Remove and set aside. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.

name: Gising-Gising
instructions: Step1: Sauté garlic, onion, chili, pork and bagoong in oil.
Step2: Add Baguio beans and water. Cook for 5 minutes.
Step3: Pour in coconut cream and season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Simmer for another 5 minutes. Transfer into a serving bowl and serve.

name: Pork Tinola
instructions: Step1: Heat cooking oil. Sauté garlic, ginger and onion until fragrant. Add pork and cook until pork turns white in color.
Step2: Pour in water and bring to boil. Season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP®. Add sayote and cook until vegetable is fork tender about 5 minutes.
Step3: Add malunggay and remove from heat.

name: Tokwa’t Baboy sa Tausi
instructions: Step1: Simmer pork in water until tender. Cut into serving pieces and reserve broth.
Step2: Fry tokwa in oil. Cut into serving pieces and set aside.
Step3: Remove oil leaving 2 tbsp. Sauté garlic, onion, ginger, chili and tausi. Add vinegar, MAGGI Soy, sugar and 1 cup of reserved broth.
Step4: Add pork and tokwa.  Simmer for another 10 minutes. Season with MAGGI® MAGIC SARAP® and stir in kinchay. Transfer into a serving plate and serve.
